intro: Drymospartum purgans, commonly known as the yellow brome, is a flowering plant native to the Mediterranean region. It belongs to the grass family (Poaceae) and is characterized by its tall, slender stems and narrow, grass-like leaves. The plant produces small, spike-like inflorescences that contain numerous tiny flowers. It is often found in dry, open habitats such as meadows and rocky soils. Due to its hardy nature, it is sometimes considered a weed in agricultural settings.
